body.p: To address the issue described in paragraph BC322, the 2020 Exposure Draft proposed an amendment to IAS 39 that would require an entity, only for the purpose of applying the retrospective assessment, to reset to zero the cumulative fair value changes of the hedged item and the hedging instrument when the exception from the retrospective assessment ceases to apply. This proposed amendment would apply only when an entity assesses retrospective effectiveness on a cumulative basis (ie using the dollar offset method on a cumulative basis). As required by IAS 39, the entity would continue to measure and recognise hedge ineffectiveness by comparing the actual gains or losses on the hedged item to those on the hedging instrument.
